When receiving movie recommendations:\n   - Ask for detailed information about each recommended movie\n   - Pretend you have limited knowledge about the movies, and the only information source about the movie is the recommender\n   - Base your decisions only on information provided by the recommender\n   - Only reject the recommendation when you find it\'s really not suitable for you after you gain enough information about the movie, do not reject the recommendation just because you don\'t know the movie\n   - Only when you decide to reject, you can ask for another recommendation\n   - Only accept the recommendation when you find it\'s really suitable for you after you gain enough information about the movie\n   - Explain your reasons for accepting or declining based on your character traits and values\n3. Keep conversations natural and concise:\n   - Think as a real seeker would think, and speak as a real seeker would speak.\n   - Engage in appropriate small talk\n   - Vary your wording and expressions\n   - Avoid repetition\n   - Do not repeat sentences that have already appeared in the conversation history\n   - Keep responses brief and to the point\n\n######\nSeeker: Hello.\nRecommender: Hello! I\'m here to help you. Could you please share your preferences or let me know what you\'re looking for? This will help me give you a more personalized recommendation.\nSeeker: Hey there! I\'ve seen a lot of action movies lately, so maybe something a bit different?\nRecommender: That sounds great! For Your Consideration (2006) is a comedy film that might interest you. It\'s directed by Christopher Guest and stars Catherine O\'Hara and Stephen Rannazzisi. Have you seen any of Christopher Guest\'s other films before? If so, how did you like them?\nSeeker: I haven\'t seen any of his films before, but I\'m curious. Can you tell me more about this one? What\'s the plot about?\nRecommender: For Your Consideration explores the lives of a group of actors auditioning for a TV sitcom. It\'s a satirical look at the entertainment industry and features a mix of real-life celebrities and fictional characters. Given your interest in something different from action, this film offers a unique and thought-provoking experience.\nSeeker: Sounds interesting! How long is the movie, and is it available on streaming platforms?\nRecommender: For Your Consideration is 86 minutes long. It\'s available on various streaming platforms, including Netflix and Amazon Prime Video. Would you like me to check if it\'s currently available for you? No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n-Disinterest: If the Seeker indicates a lack of interest, such as requesting a different recommendation or showing dissatisfaction with the suggestion (but not explicitly rejecting it), return 2. No, the Seeker is not interested in the recommendation.\n-Ongoing Interest: If the Seeker continues to ask more questions without making a final decision, continue considering the recommendation as still under evaluation.\n\nResponse options:\n1. No, the Recommender has not yet made a recommendation to the Seeker.\n2. No, the Seeker is not interested in the recommendation.\n3. No, the Seeker has rejected the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n4. Yes, the Seeker is interested in the recommendation.\n5. Yes, the Seeker has accepted the Recommender\'s recommendation.\n\nGuidance:\n- Only consider a recommendation accepted when the Seeker explicitly agrees to try it or shows intent to watch the movie.\n- If the Seeker is still asking questions or showing curiosity about the details of the recommendation, they have not yet accepted or rejected it.\n\nPlease make sure your response is only one of the five options, and output corresponding sentence without contents in the brackets and without any other words.\n\nThe conversation history is as follows: \nSeeker: Hello.\nRecommender: Hi there! Would you like to discuss a movie or share your preferences for a certain type of film?\nSeeker: Hey! Yes, I\'m up for discussing some movies. I\'ve been looking for something to watch lately. Do you have any recommendations?\nRecommender: That sounds great! Have you seen any documentaries before? I have a recommendation for you: Cinemania (2002), a documentary that explores the passionate world of cinephiles in New York City. Would you be interested in learning more about it?\nSeeker: Sure, I\'d love to learn more about it. Can you tell me more about the content and style of the documentary?\nRecommender: Certainly! Cinemania features five movie enthusiasts who are incredibly dedicated to their love of films. The documentary offers an engaging and insightful look at the vibrant culture surrounding cinema in New York City. It\'s 83 minutes long and provides a deep dive into the world of cinephilia.\nSeeker: 83 minutes seems like a good length. What kind of people are featured in the documentary? Are they all from New York City?\nRecommender: Yes, all the individuals featured in Cinemania are from New York City. They are passionate movie enthusiasts who share their thoughts and experiences about cinema, making for an interesting and relatable watch. Cinemania explores various themes such as the impact of cinema on personal lives, the importance of film festivals, and the role of independent cinema. It also touches on the challenges and joys of being a cinephile in today\'s world.\nSeeker: I see. It seems like a well-rounded documentary. I\'ve been thinking about watching something new but haven\'t decided yet.\nRecommender: That sounds great! Have you had any preferences in mind, like genres or specific themes? Opinion Inquiry: What do you think about dramas with thriller elements? Do you enjoy stories that keep you on the edge of your seat?\nSeeker: I do enjoy dramas with a bit of suspense. It keeps me engaged. Can you recommend a few titles in that genre?\nRecommender: 《The One I Love》(2014) is a fantastic choice for you. This indicates the Seeker has decided to act on the suggestion.\n-Rejection: If the Seeker explicitly rejects the recommendation, such as saying "I\'m not interested" or "Can you recommend something else?" return 3.
